title: PfMP Practice Exam 02
description: Comprehensive practice test covering Governance, Stakeholder Engagement, and Life Cycle Management.

questions.text: Mr. Henry is a Portfolio Manager and is working on his portfolio during portfolio construction to create a variety of portfolio scenarios using different combinations of both potential and current components. Which process, tool & technique is Mr. Henry involved in and what is the output?

options.text: Develop Charter, Scenario Analysis, Portfolio Structure
Develop Charter, Capability and Capacity Analysis, Portfolio Structure
Develop Charter, Capability and Capacity Analysis, Portfolio

questions.explanation:
Scenario analysis is an analytical method that enables decision makers to create a variety of portfolio scenarios using different combinations of both potential and current components, evaluating their possible outcomes. The result of this analysis is the portfolio structure (Reference: Standard of Portfolio Management 3rd ed, section 4.2.2.1, Pg# 48)

- C&C Analysis is a T&T of Develop Portfolio Charter process, however, it is performed to understand how much work portfolio is able to perform based on the resources available (capacity), as well as the ability to determine the constraints generated by certain skill set limitations, financial, asset capacity factors (capability). It does not determine the portfolio structure
- ‘Portfolio’ is not an output of Develop Portfolio Charter process

questions.text:
You are working as the Portfolio Manager in the ERP portfolio of Al-Hamd organization. You are currently defining the metrics to measure the portfolio benefits and value towards the organizational objectives during Portfolio Execution.

Which of the following is covered as part of activities performed during Define Portfolio Performance Management Plan process?

options.text: Portfolio Value and Component Resource Management

questions.explanation:
The Portfolio Performance Management Plan documents how the organization plans to measure, monitor, control and report (1) portfolio performance, (2) resource management, and (3) portfolio value (Reference: Standard of Portfolio Management 3rd ed, Read the introductory para of Section 6.1, Pg# 87)

- The other choice are incorrect. Component performance, resource management and value delivery is performed as part of component management (project & program management), not portfolio management. Portfolio manager uses the performance, resource and value delivery reports from component managers, and aggregate them as part of portfolio reports to present to

questions.text:
As the Portfolio Manager, you have scored the portfolio components and are analyzing the data in order to prioritize the components. Consider that your portfolio would get organizational resources for two components only. Using the following multi-criteria scoring table, which would be the top two components that will be executed in your portfolio?

| Portfolio Components | Component Score |
| :--- | :--- |
| Customer Growth Program - A | 100 |
| Technological Adv Project - B | 387.5 |
| Regulatory Project - C | 341.4 |
| Revenue Generation Project - D | 561.3 |
questions.explanation: As per the Multi-criteria scoring technique, the higher the component score, the higher the priority. However, mandatory criteria, such as regulatory, legal, operations deserve particular attention. Portfolio components that are required to comply with such mandates need to ensure their inclusion in the final portfolio regardless of their scoring and ranking. The other components would be ranked in the portfolio as per the scoring. Accordingly, the two components that would be selected in the given portfolio are component C and D (Reference: Standard of Portfolio Management 3rd ed, Section 5.2.2.3, Last few lines of Weighted Ranking and Scoring technique, Pg# 70)

questions.text: As the Portfolio Manager of VirtualTech portfolio at TGR organization, you have just created an initial list of portfolio components. In which portfolio management process are you working?
questions.explanation:
The 'Portfolio' that is created as a result of 'Develop Portfolio Strategic plan' process is just a high level initial list of components (Reference: Standard of Portfolio Management 3rd ed, section 4.1.3.2, Pg# 46)

- The purpose of the 'Define Portfolio' process is to create an up-to-date comprehensive list of qualified portfolio components by identifying, categorizing, scoring, and ranking portfolio components which is eventually executed in the organization
- 'Develop Portfolio Charter' and 'Define Roadmap' processes do not create Portfolio jey deliverable as output

questions.text: Authorizing and Controlling process group consists of all the below activities except:

options.text: Alignment of portfolio components to the organizational strategy
Track and monitor component performance for strategic alignment

questions.explanation:
'Alignment of portfolio components to the organizational strategy' is activity of Aligning process group. Aligning Process Group consists of processes to manage and optimize the portfolio. This process group determines how portfolio components will be categorized, evaluated, selected for inclusion, modification, or elimination in the portfolio. The processes in this process group enable a structured method for aligning the mix of portfolio components to the organization’s strategy (Reference: Standard of Portfolio Management 3rd ed, section 3.1.2, Pg# 32)

- The other choices are activities of A&C process group. Authorizing and Controlling process group determines how to monitor strategic changes; tracks and reviews performance indicators for alignment; and authorizes the portfolio components. These authorizing and oversight processes are the active part of the portfolio and are usually an ongoing function of the organization's governing body.

questions.text: You are working as the Portfolio Manager in the ERP portfolio of Al-Hamd organization. You are currently defining the key performance metrics to measure the portfolio benefits and value towards the organizational objectives during Portfolio Execution. It is important that portfolio performance metrics are SMART objectives. SMART stands for:
questions.explanation: Portfolio performance measures and targets (metrics) are set at the portfolio component level and then rolled up to the portfolio level to determine overall portfolio impact. In order to develop meaningful measures, metrics should be SMART (Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Realistic, Timebound) ((Reference: Standard of Portfolio Management 3rd ed, Section 6.1.2.1, Pg# 89)

questions.text: Julia Thomas, a stakeholder in your organization has complained to you that she did not receive the portfolio information that she needed. What should you do first as the Portfolio Manager?
questions.explanation:
Review of Communication Management plan makes sense here, as it documents who will receive what information, at what time, and in what format (Reference: Standard of Portfolio Management 3rd ed, Section 7.1.3.1, Pg# 113)

- Communication Strategy Matrix review is not needed here, as SH needs have not really changed
- Stakeholder Matrix review is not needed here, the scenario does not talk about any change in SH needs
- The scenario here does not warrant a risk situation, may be the RR needs to be updated as a result of CMP review. However, if the case be, this will happen later
